abstracts.cdata!:
The principal objective of the
            Geothermal Development and Energy Pre-Investment Project is
            to assist Kenya in preparing the necessary expansion of its
            generating capacity, and in particular the mobilization for
            a major geothermal program. The project is composed of two
            components. The first, a geothermal component, which
            consists of : (i) drilling supplies and materials for 32
            wells; (ii) procurement of a drilling rig rated for 2800
            meters; (iii) drilling infrastructure and geothermal
            scientific equipment; and (iv) 36 man-months of technical
            assistance and an engineering study. The second component is
            energy preinvestment, which consists of : (i) a feasibility
            study of hydro resources of the Miriu-Sondu basin, and an
            engineering report for the Lower Miriu weir and power
            station; (ii) comparative reconnaissance on several
            potential hydro sites; (iii) an energy pricing study; (iv) a
            study of the Kenyan LPG supply; and (v) a rural
            electrification cost minimization study.
